histogram.name: Blink.Accessibility.NumTreeUpdatesQueuedBeforeLayout
histogram.summary: Records how many tree updates were queued at the time updates are being processed after layout. If we are trying to process too many updates at once, we should investigate how we might be able to merge similar updates without losing important information.

histogram.name: Blink.Animate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent processing main frame animations during a main frame update.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.Animation.CompositedAnimationFailureReason
histogram.summary:
Reasons an Animation is not suitable for running on the compositor thread.
Note that a given Animation may have more than one reason, so this histogram cannot be used to determine the overall rate of 'composited' vs 'noncomposited' animations.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.2DPrintingAsVector
histogram.summary: Records if a Canvas is being printed as a vector or as an image.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ContentChangeMode
histogram.summary: Records whether the contents in the canvas buffer needed to be preserved via a copy when replacing the target buffer for drawing a new frame. This metric is recorded each time the target buffer needs to be replaced. It's recorded once per frame.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ContextType
histogram.summary: Records the context type names used to create canvas rendering contexts.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.CreateImageBitmapSource
histogram.summary: The source from which an ImageBitmap is created by a createImageBitmap call.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.DrawImage.Duration
histogram.summary:
Time spent on the main thread during a 2D canvas drawImage API call.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.DrawImage.SqrtNumberOfPixels
histogram.summary: Stores the square root of the number of pixels drawn into a Canvas. Different histograms per CanvasImageSource.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.GetImageDataScaledDuration
histogram.summary:
Time in microseconds * 10 (10e-5 seconds) spent on the 2D canvas getImageData API call, divided by the square root of the total number of pixels of the image extracted from the canvas. Smaller is faster.
The idea behind this elaborated unit is that the bigger the area of a canvas the longer the operation GetImageData takes, so we want a way to measure the overall performance regardless of the size of the canvas.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-01-31 to 2021-05-10; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.GPUFallbackToCPU
histogram.summary: Logs the occurrences of canvas fallback from GPU to CPU.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.HasRendered
histogram.summary: Records if the canvas has been rendered at least once. Recorded on disposal.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.HibernationEvents
histogram.summary: Records the occurrence of events related to 2D canvas GPU resource hibernation.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ImageSmoothingQuality
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M92. This metric is added to do some research, and the research is now completed.
histogram.summary: Records the image smoothing quality used by draw image. Users can choose between none, low, medium or high image quality.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.IsComposited
histogram.summary:
Records if the canvas context is composited or not. Recorded in HTMLCanvasElement::GetCanvasRenderingContext.
Note: This has been recording bad data since at least 2020-01-01. It was emitted in the wrong place and always recording false. Since it records the same information as IsAccelerated, I am just going to let it expire.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.MaximumInflightResources
histogram.summary: Reports the maximum number or canvas resources used at any one time by a canvas resource provider. Logged in the destructor of CanvasResourceProvider.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.NumCanvasesPerPage
histogram.summary: When a Document is shutdown, reports the number of canvases on that page.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.PutImageDataScaledDuration
histogram.summary:
Time in microseconds * 10 (10e-5 seconds) spent on the 2D canvas putImageData API call, divided by the square root of the total number of pixels of the imageData painted into the canvas. Smaller is faster.
The idea behind this elaborated unit is that the bigger the area of a canvas the longer the operation PutImageData takes, so we want a way to measure the overall performance regardless of the size of the canvas.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-01-31 to 2021-05-10; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.RasterDuration
histogram.summary:
Records the CPU, GPU and combined raster time for a random sampling of canvas frames for accelerated and deferred canvases. Records wall time for a random sampling of unaccelerated canvases.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.RequestedImageMimeTypes
histogram.summary: Records the occurence of image file formats passed into toDataURL and toBlob functions in canvas.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ResourceProviderIsAccelerated
histogram.summary: Logs if the canvas resource provider is accelerated or not.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ResourceProviderType
histogram.summary: Records the type of resource provider used for a canvas.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ResourceProviderUsage
histogram.summary: Records the requested resource usage for a canvas resource provider.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.SqrtNumberOfPixels
histogram.summary: Stores the square root of the number of pixels in a new or resized offscreen canvas. Emitted from CanvasRenderingContextHost::RecordCanvasSizeToUMA.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.CompleteEncodingDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M89. Obsolete and unused. This has been replaced with Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.TotalEncodingDelay
histogram.summary:
This metric measures the total time spent on completing encoding all the rows of an image (jpeg or png), as part of a canvas.toBlob API call. Encoding occurs during one or more idle periods on the main thread and the waiting time of the next idle period is included in the measurement. If the code has swtiched to force encoding path, we will not measure the delay in this metric.
This metric is useful in helping us adjust the IdleTaskCompleteTimeoutDelay in canvas.toBlob. When the encoding idle task is delayed for longer than IdleTaskCompleteTimeoutDelay, the browser will switch to a non-idle task to force encoding to happen on the main thread.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.IdleTaskStatus
histogram.summary:
Records the status of the idle task when finishing a toBlob call.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitialEncodingDelay.{Type}
histogram.summary:
A new version of "Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitiateEncodingDelay" (which will be allowed to expire) which allows for times >10ms.
This metric measures the time spent from initiating image encoding (jpeg or png) on idle task to the actual execution time of initiation, as part of a canvas.toBlob API call.
This metric is useful in helping us adjust the IdleTaskStartTimeoutDelay in canvas.toBlob. When the initialization idle task is delayed for longer than IdleTaskStartTimeoutDelay, the browser will switch to a non-idle task to force initialization and encoding to occur on the main thread.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitiateEncodingDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M89. Obsolete and unused. This has been replaced with Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitialEncodingDelay
histogram.summary:
This metric measures the time spent from initiating image encoding (jpeg or png) on idle task to the actual execution time of initiation, as part of a canvas.toBlob API call.
This metric is useful in helping us adjust the IdleTaskStartTimeoutDelay in canvas.toBlob. When the initialization idle task is delayed for longer than IdleTaskStartTimeoutDelay, the browser will switch to a non-idle task to force initialization and encoding to occur on the main thread.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.ScaledDuration
histogram.summary:
Time in microseconds spent on the 2D canvas toBlob API call, divided by the square root of the total number of pixels of the canvas.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.TotalEncodingDelay.{Type}
histogram.summary:
A new version of "Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitiateEncodingDelay" (which will be allowed to expire) which allows for times >10ms.
This metric measures the total time spent on completing encoding all the rows of an image (jpeg or png), as part of a canvas.toBlob API call. Encoding occurs during one or more idle periods on the main thread and the waiting time of the next idle period is included in the measurement. If the code has swtiched to force encoding path, we will not measure the delay in this metric.
This metric is useful in helping us adjust the IdleTaskCompleteTimeoutDelay in canvas.toBlob. When the encoding idle task is delayed for longer than IdleTaskCompleteTimeoutDelay, the browser will switch to a non-idle task to force encoding to happen on the main thread.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToDataURLScaledDuration
histogram.summary:
Time spent on 2D canvas toDataURL API call divided by the square root of the total number of pixels of the image. Smaller is faster.
The idea behind this unit is that the bigger the area of a canvas the longer the operation ToDataURL takes, so we want a way to measure the overall performance regardless of the size of the canvas.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.WebGPUMaxRecycledResourcesCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of total unused recyclable WebGPU resources since last clean-up. Logged in the WebGPU recyclable resouce clean-up timer function.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.WebGPUMaxRecycledResourcesInKB
histogram.summary: The maximum size of total unused recyclable WebGPU resources in KB since last clean-up. Logged in the WebGPU recyclable resouce clean-up timer function.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.WebGPUStaleResourceCount
histogram.summary: The number of stale recyclable WebGPU canvas resources released and logged in the WebGPU recyclable resouce clean-up timer function.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.WillReadFrequently
histogram.summary: Logs if the canvas is initialized to be read frequently or not.

histogram.name: Blink.Clipboard.Paste.Image
histogram.summary: When HTML is parsed during a paste operation, image elements may have a source attribute pointing to a local file url, http(s) url, cid or other url type which doesn't render the image when it's pasted inside a content editable region. This metric will help us determine how many paste operations have an image with a src url attribute containing the url types mentioned above and whether there is an RTF format in the clipboard along with HTML or not. The RTF format data will help us decide whether we need to support paste for images that are in RTF format types when it's available on the clipboard along with HTML format so the apps can use it to insert the images which then can be used by the Browser to replace the src urls of the images in the HTML markup with a Blob url. This would enable the site to store the images when it's pasted inside a content editable region.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorGamut.Destination
histogram.summary: Gamut properties of destination color space.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination
histogram.summary: Gamma properties of destination color space.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.NonlinearFitErrorCombined
histogram.summary: The L-infinity error (in 8-bit values) of the numerical approximation of table-based ICC profile transfer functions for all channels combined, when the nonlinear approximation converged.

histogram.name: Blink.Compositing.LayerPromotionCount
histogram.summary: Number of composited layers based on various reasons. Recorded when a page finishes its layer updates.

histogram.name: Blink.CompositingAssignments.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating compositing assignments in the Blink document lifecycle. This is the legacy compositing approach.
Note: this histogram has stopped recording metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.CompositingCommit.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating and pushing layers at the end of the paint step in the Blink document lifecycle. This is the new compositing approach in CompositeAfterPaint and is largely implemented by PaintArtifactCompositor. BlinkGenPropertyTrees is an incremental launch of part of the new compositing approach and will use both this and Blink.{CompositingInputs+CompositingAssignments}.UpdateTime.
Note: As of M70, this histogram has stopped recording metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.CompositingInputs.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating compositing inputs in the Blink document lifecycle. This is the legacy compositing approach.
Note: this histogram has stopped recording metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.Compression.CompressionStream.Format
histogram.summary: Compression format passed to the constructor of the JavaScript API "CompressionStream", which is used for lossless compression of arbitrary binary data. Recorded once per call to the constructor. This measures which compression formats are most commonly used in the wild.

histogram.name: Blink.Compression.DecompressionStream.Format
histogram.summary: Compression format passed to the constructor of the JavaScript API "DecompressionStream", which is used for lossless decompression of arbitrary binary data. Recorded once per call to the constructor. This measures which compression formats are most commonly used in the wild.

histogram.name: Blink.ContentDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document for a canvas draw, SVG image draw or plugin during a main frame update. Includes time spent in style update and layout.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.ContextMenu.ImageSelection.Depth
histogram.summary:
The depth of the discovered image node in the hit test list when performing a penetrating image selection search.
Only recorded when the `EnablePenetratingImageSelection` feature is enabled and a user long presses or right clicks a document (and an image is found).

histogram.name: Blink.ContextMenu.ImageSelection.ElapsedTime
histogram.summary:
The amount of time it took to iterate through the dom looking for an image node.
Only recorded when the `EnablePenetratingImageSelection` feature is enabled and a user long presses or right clicks a document.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Blink.ContextMenu.ImageSelection.Outcome
histogram.summary:
The outcome of an image selection search that may or may not trigger the context menu.
Only recorded when the `EnablePenetratingImageSelection` feature is enabled and a user long presses or right clicks a document (and an image is found).

histogram.name: Blink.ContextMenu.ImageSelection.RetrievalOutcome
histogram.summary:
The outcome of a follow up retrieval of an image node after a selection has occurred, which occurs asynchronously and thus could be unsuccessful due to changes that may occur between the initial hit test and the retrieval.
Only recorded when the `EnablePenetratingImageSelection` feature is enabled and a user long presses or right clicks a document (and an image is found).

histogram.name: Blink.CookieStore.MatchType
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M87.
histogram.summary: Records match type option set by the developer for Cookie Store query APIs to measure the usage of the option during Origin Trial to better evaluate the best shape of the API.

histogram.name: Blink.CSSPaintValue.PaintOffThread
histogram.summary: Records if a CSS Paint is painted on the compositor thread or has fallen back to the main thread.

histogram.name: Blink.DarkMode.ApplyToImageOnMainThread
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing each inverted dark mode image on the main thread. This includes both image decoding and classification.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.DensitySizeCorrectionDetected
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M89.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a decoded image contains density correction metadata, i.e. when its resolution and dimension EXIF values match.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity.KiBWeighted
histogram.summary: The compressed image size in KiB per image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for JPEGs with at least 100 pixels on the smallest dimension (width or height). The reported count for a sample represents the image size rounded to the nearest KiB.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.Orientation
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M88.
histogram.summary: Image orientation inferred during decode.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.WebPFileFormat
histogram.summary: WebP file format parsed during Blink's header parsing phase (which should happen only once per image).

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImageType
histogram.summary: Image codec inferred during decode.

histogram.name: Blink.DisplayLockIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is for Display Locking. Recorded when an intersection observation is made for the Display Locking reason.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.EffectiveZoom
histogram.summary: The EffectiveZoom as reported by ComputedStyle in a Blink renderer. The value is reported each time the effective zoom is set to a new value. The maximum zoom reported is 400% to keep the histogram of reasonable size.

histogram.name: Blink.Fetch.RequestResourceTime
histogram.summary:
The total microseconds spent in ResourceFetcher::requestResource.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.AndroidFontLookupLoadFromFileTime
histogram.summary: Records the duration it takes to load the font lookup table from file. Reported when the font unique name lookup table is loaded at browser startup on Android and loading was successful. The metric is not recorded when the file did not exist or could not be parsed; use Blink.Fonts.AndroidFontScanningLoadFromFileSuccess to determine how often this metric is recorded.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.AndroidFontLookupTableReadyTime
histogram.summary: Records the duration it takes from starting to prepare the font lookup table until it is ready. Independent of whether it is loaded from file or whether the fonts are scanned. Reported when the font unique name lookup table is loaded at browser startup on Android.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.AndroidFontScanningLoadFromFileSuccess
histogram.summary: Counts the ratio of whether it was possible to load the font table from file successfully or not. Reported when the font unique name lookup table is loaded at browser startup on Android.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.AndroidFontScanningPersistToFileSuccess
histogram.summary: Counts the ratio of whether it was possible to store the font table to disk after the metadata has been indexed. Reported on Android when the font unique name lookup table is stored after indexing.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.AndroidFontScanningResult
histogram.summary: Reports success or failure of extracting metadata from a single font file. Reported when the font unique name lookup table is rebuilt on Android (i.e. after a firmware update or first start with empty cache folder).

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.AndroidFontScanningTableBuildTime
histogram.summary: Records duration of scanning available fonts for font name metadata, sorting the list and making it available to renderers. Reported when the font unique name lookup table is rebuilt on Android (i.e. after a firmware update or first start with empty cache folder).

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.AndroidFontScanningUpdateNeeded
histogram.summary: Counts the ratio of whether it was necessary to rebuild the font table or not. Reported when after the unique name lookup table is loaded from disk at browser startup on Android.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.DataAccess.StreamCreation
histogram.summary: Counts success or failure in attempting to obtain font bytes as stream with base address from Skia.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.EmojiClusterBrokenness
histogram.summary: Percentage of emoji clusters of all emoji clusters going through shaping calls that are shaped as either .notdef/tofu glyphs or are shapes as more than one glyph, which usually indicates that an emoji sequence was not shaped correctly due to the emoji font not supporting it. Recorded per page/worker and on page unload if the page contained emoji.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.Enumeration.Duration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M89. Obsolete and unused. This has been replaced with Fonts.AccessAPI.EnumerationCache.*
histogram.summary: Records duration of enumerating available fonts for font name metadata. Reported on Mac platforms only, when the fonts are enumerated from the system APIs if there is a cache miss.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.FontFamilyMatchAttempts.System
histogram.summary: Number of system font family match attempts made, from page load to page unload. Recorded on page unload.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.FontMatchAttempts.System
histogram.summary: Number of system font match attempts (success + failure) made via @font-face src:local(), from page load to page unload. Recorded on page unload.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.ShapeCache
histogram.summary: Total number of entries in all Blink ShapeCache instances. The value is reported each time the FontCache::purge() method is called.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.VariableFontsRatio
histogram.summary: Tracks adoption ratio of variable fonts compared to conventional (in the sense of non-variable) web fonts. Recorded at the time of instantiating a Skia SkTypeface from the successfully decoded web font blob.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.WindowsUniqueLocalFontInstantiationResult
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a locally uniquely matched font can be instantiated inside the renderer. Recorded at the time the renderer tries to instantiate the font in the font cache. If it fails (in rare cases), it can either be caused by the font being placed outside the Windows Fonts directory, or for an unknown reason. Track this to identify whether a browser side helper is needed to open the file handle outside the sandbox and pass it into the renderer.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.WinFallback.LegacyNoneFound
histogram.summary: Tracks Blink Windows font fallback results while migrating to API based fallback vs. the previous use of a hard-coded list. Records a data point when the legacy hard-coded list code did not find fallback for a particular Unicode code block ID (ICU::UBlockCode). Recorded at the time of Blink layout code requesting a fallback font for a character and locale.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.WinFallback.LegacyWinAPIDisagree
histogram.summary: Tracks Blink Windows font fallback results while migrating to API based fallback vs. the previous use of a hard-coded list. Records a data point when the Windows API out of process fallback code and the legacy hard-coded list fallback code disagree in fallback font result for a particular Unicode code block ID (ICU::UBlockCode). Recorded at the time of Blink layout code requesting a fallback font for a character and locale.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.WinFallback.NoFallbackFound
histogram.summary: Tracks Blink Windows font fallback results while migrating to API based fallback vs. the previous use of a hard-coded list. Records a data point when no fallback font result was found for a particular Unicode code block ID (ICU::UBlockCode) through either the out-of-process Windows DWrite API or the hard-coded list fallback code. Recorded at the time of Blink layout code requesting a fallback font for a character and locale.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.WinFallback.WinAPINoneFound
histogram.summary: Tracks Blink Windows font fallback results while migrating to API based fallback vs. the previous use of a hard-coded list. Records a data point when the Windows API out of process fallback code did not find fallback for a particular Unicode code block ID (ICU::UBlockCode). Recorded at the time of Blink layout code requesting a fallback font for a character and locale.

histogram.name: Blink.ForcedStyleAndLayout.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing layouts due to Javascript value requests. Specifically, time spent in Blink Document::UpdateStyleAndLayout.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HandleInputEvents.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent processing rAF-aligned input during a main frame update.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HitTestDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document for hit testing during a main frame update. It does not compute the actual hit test time, rather the style, layout, compositing, etc time to prepare for the test.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ChunkCount
histogram.summary:
The number of chunks parsed while loading a page. Each chunk represents a piece of the HTML content that can be loaded without blocking or yielding.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ChunkCount2
histogram.summary:
The number of chunks parsed while loading a page. Each chunk represents a piece of the HTML content that can be loaded without blocking or yielding. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.InputCharacterCount
histogram.summary:
The number of characters processed while parsing a document during page load. This is computed as the sum of all the characters appended to the input string sequence for the parser.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeMax
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum time used to parse a single chunk before being blocked, yielding or completing, in microseconds.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeMax2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum time used to parse a single chunk before being blocked, yielding or completing, in microseconds. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeMin
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum time used to parse a single chunk before being blocked, yielding or completing, in microseconds.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeMin2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum time used to parse a single chunk before being blocked, yielding or completing, in microseconds. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeTotal
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the total amount of time spent in the HTMLDocumentParser performing parsing, in microseconds.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.ParsingTimeTotal2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the total amount of time spent in the HTMLDocumentParser performing parsing, in microseconds. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedAverage
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the average number of tokens parsed across all chunks.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedAverage2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the average number of tokens parsed across all chunks. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedMax
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum number of tokens parsed as a chunk.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedMax2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum number of tokens parsed as a chunk. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedMin
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum number of tokens parsed as a chunk.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.TokensParsedMin2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum number of tokens parsed as a chunk. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeAverage
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the average time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeAverage2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the average time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeMax
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeMax2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the maximum time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeMin
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.HTMLParsing.YieldedTimeMin2
histogram.summary:
While parsing a page, the minimum time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will not be recorded if only one chunk was parsed. This version is for Forced Synchronous HTML Parsing.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.IncrementalDecodeNeeded
histogram.summary:
For JPEG and WebP images, whether all image data has been received before decoding begins or whether we are still receiving data and will need to send partial image data to the decoder and pause/resume decoding until complete.
It is emitted when the DeferredImageDecoder is about to create the first DecodingImageGenerator for an image.

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.IncrementallyDecodedByteSize
histogram.summary: Images for which only partial image data has been received before decoding begins. This may be because the image is very large or complex (less compressed) or because of slow network or resource loading. More precisely, the bucket in which the decode will be counted (IncrementallyDecoded or InitiallyFullyDecoded) is computed when the DeferredImageDecoder is about to create the first DecodingImageGenerator for an image and the byte size is emitted when all data is received.

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.InitiallyFullyDecodedByteSize
histogram.summary: Images for which all image data has been received before decoding begins. This may be because the image has a small file size (very compressed), because of a fast network/resource loading connection, because the data was preloaded with JavaScript, or because a decode was requested through JavaScript IMG.decode() API, which must wait for all data to be received per the specification. More precisely, the bucket in which the decode will be counted (IncrementallyDecoded or InitiallyFullyDecoded) is computed when the DeferredImageDecoder is about to create the first DecodingImageGenerator for an image and the byte size is emitted when all data is received.

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.Jpeg.Area
histogram.summary: Number of pixels in a decoded JPEG image. Recorded after decoding is done by Blink's JPEG decoder (as opposed to, possibly, a hardware decode accelerator). Tracking the image area may include degenerate cases, e.g., an image with area = 10000 and dimensions = 1x10000. However, it is reasonable to assume these cases are relatively rare and the area of the image can serve as a proxy of how useful a decode accelerator can be (the larger the area, the better).

histogram.name: Blink.ImageDecoders.Jpeg.ColorSpace
histogram.summary: JPEG color space of a decoded image as guessed by libjpeg_turbo. Recorded after decoding is done by Blink's JPEG decoder (as opposed to, possibly, a hardware decode accelerator). When the color space is YCbCr, the chroma subsampling is also recorded.

histogram.name: Blink.ImplCompositorCommit.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating layers in the compositor thread during a ProxyMain::BeginMainFrame. It is the actual work time, excluding time spent waiting for the compositor thread to begin.
Note: This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.Input.GestureScrollBeginAsCursorControl
histogram.summary: Records if a GestureScrollBegin is for cursor control.

histogram.name: Blink.IntersectionObservation.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: As of M70, this histogram has stopped recording metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.JavaJsBridge.MethodInvocationError
histogram.summary: Records the Java/JS bridge method invocation errors.

histogram.name: Blink.JavascriptDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document to answer a Javascript API query or request. Examples include scrool offset requests, queries of layout dimensions, SVG path queries, etc. Includes time spent in style update and layout, or via EnsurePaintLocationDataValidForNode. Some of these calls may be servicing internal needs, but we have no way to disambiguate those from JS driven activity.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.JavascriptIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is due to a Javascript request. Recorded when an intersection observation is made for the Javascript reason.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.KeyboardLock.MethodCalled
histogram.summary: Records each call to the navigator.keyboard{Lock|Unlock} methods.

histogram.name: Blink.Layout.FlexNGRatio.Blocks
histogram.summary:
Records FlexNG block percentage.
This records the percentage of LayoutNGFlexibleBox objects, compared with the total number of blocks. This is recorded once per page on unloading the page. A value takes into account of all frames in a single page.
See https://bit.ly/ng-ratio for more details.

histogram.name: Blink.Layout.GridNGRatio.Blocks
histogram.summary:
Records GridNG block percentage.
This records the percentage of LayoutNGGrid objects, compared with the total number of blocks. This is recorded once per page on unloading the page. A value takes into account of all frames in a single page.
See https://bit.ly/ng-ratio for more details.

histogram.name: Blink.Layout.NGRatio.Blocks
histogram.summary:
Records LayoutNG ratio for the number of blocks.
This records a percentage of LayoutNG-based blocks relative to all blocks. This is recorded once per page on unloading the page. A value takes into account of all frames in a single page.
See https://bit.ly/ng-ratio for more details.

histogram.name: Blink.Layout.NGRatio.Calls
histogram.summary:
Records LayoutNG ratio for the number of UpdateLayout calls.
This records a percentage of UpdateLayout() calls for LayoutNG-based objects relative to all UpdateLayout() calls. This is recorded once per page on unloading the page. A value takes into account of all frames in a single page.
See https://bit.ly/ng-ratio for more details.

histogram.name: Blink.Layout.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating layout in the Blink document lifecycle.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.LazyLoad.CrossOriginFrames.InitialDeferralAction
histogram.summary: Records the initial lazy loading action taken for a cross-origin iframe.

histogram.name: Blink.LazyLoad.CrossOriginFrames.LoadStartedAfterBeingDeferred
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type whenever a lazily-loaded iframe that wasn't initially hidden or near the viewport starts loading. The count for an effective connection type in this histogram can be subtracted from the 'Deferred' bucket from the Blink.LazyLoad.CrossOriginFrames.InitialDeferralAction.* histogram for the corresponding effective connection type to determine the number of iframes that LazyLoad is avoiding to load altogether.

histogram.name: Blink.LazyLoad.CrossOriginFrames.VisibleAfterBeingDeferred
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type whenever a lazily-loaded iframe that wasn't initially hidden or near the viewport becomes visible. The count for an effective connection type in this histogram can be subtracted from the corresponding count in Blink.LazyLoad.CrossOriginFrames.LoadStartedAfterBeingDeferred to determine how many iframes were loaded unnecessarily by LazyLoad.

histogram.name: Blink.LazyLoadIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is due to a Lazy Image Loading request. Recorded when an intersection observation is made to determine when a lazy loaded image should be loaded.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.AnimateRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing Main Frame animations and rAF callbacks.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.CompositingAssignmentsRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing compositing assignments.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.CompositingCommitRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for committing paint results to the compositor.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.CompositingInputsRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing compositing inputs.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.CompositingRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing Compositing.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.ForcedStyleAndLayoutRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The time between each paint results commit used in computing forced style recalc and layouts for this document and ancestors as a percentage of the Blink local frame lifecycle update time.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.HandleInputEventsRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for processing rAF aligned input.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.HitTestDocumentUpdateRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for updating the document in preparation for hit testing.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.ImplCompositorCommitRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for committing the layer tree to the impl thread, excluding time spend waiting for the CC thread to begin processing.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.IntersectionObservationRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing Intersection Observations.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.LayoutRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing Layout.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.PaintRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing Paint.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.PrePaintRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing PrePaint.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.ScrollingCoordinatorRatio
histogram.obsolete: Merged into Blink.MainFrame.CompositingCommitRatio in http://crrev.com/815947 in M88.
histogram.summary: The percentage of the total BeginMainFrame execution time used for the ScrollingCoordinator update in Blink, for each frame that we record. Recorded in ScrollingCoordinator::UpdateAfterPaint.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.StyleRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing Style.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.UpdateLayersRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is spent in LayerTreeHost::UpdateLayers.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink.
This histogram will not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.WaitForCommitRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed M88 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is spent waiting for the CC thread to begin processing.

histogram.name: Blink.MediaIntersectionObserver.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing IntersectionObserver observations in the Blink document lifecycle where the observation is for a media element. Recorded when an intersection observation is made attributed to a media element (such as video auto-play).
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for non-preloading requests for each resource type. https://crbug.com/579496

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.AsyncScript
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for non-preloading requests of async and defer scripts. https://crbug.com/1043679

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Dead
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for requests that hit Resource only referenced from MemoryCache for each resource type. https://crbug.com/579496 Requests counted by this are also counted by Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy or Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Preload.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.PerDocument
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M89. Obsolete and unused. This has been replaced with Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy with feature ScopeMemoryCachePerContext.
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for requests for each resource type. Logged only if the resource is found in the memory cache and if the same document had loaded this resource earlier.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.PerTopFrameSite
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for requests for each resource type. Logged only if the resource is found in the memory cache and if the same top-frame site had loaded this resource earlier.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Preload
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for preloading requests for each resource type. https://crbug.com/579496

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.ContextType
histogram.summary: Records the context type names used to create offscreen canvas rendering contexts. Recorded in OffscreenCanvas::GetCanvasRenderingContext

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.NewOffscreenCanvas
histogram.summary: Records the creation of a new offscreen canvas in OffscreenCanvas::Create.

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.SqrtNumberOfPixels
histogram.summary: Stores the square root of the number of pixels in a new or resized offscreen canvas. Emitted from CanvasRenderingContextHost::RecordCanvasSizeToUMA.

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.TransferControlToOffscreen
histogram.summary: Records a call to transfer a canvas offscreen.

histogram.name: Blink.OffscreenCanvas.Transferred
histogram.summary: Records when an offscreen canvas has been transferred from the main thread to a worker.

histogram.name: Blink.Paint.CachedItemPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of cached display items among all display items. Higher value means higher performance beause of less paint invalidation. Recorded when we finish updating paint in the Blink document lifecycle.

histogram.name: Blink.Paint.CachedSubsequencePercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of cached subsequences of display items among all subsequences. Higher value means higher performance beause of less subsequence invalidation. Recorded when we finish updating paint in the Blink document lifecycle.

histogram.name: Blink.Paint.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating paint in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: As of M70, this histogram has stopped recording metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.PrePaint.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating paint properties and paint invalidation in the Blink document lifecycle. Available when SlimmingPaintInvalidation or SlimmingPaintV2 is enabled.
Note: As of M70, this histogram has stopped recording metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.Render.DisplayLockActivationReason
histogram.summary: This indicates the reason for display-locking activation

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceFetcher.StaleWhileRevalidateDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2020.
histogram.summary: Duration of completed stale revalidation attempts.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.TrafficBytes.KBPerFrameStatus
histogram.summary:
Total encoded size of resources associated with frames of a particular type. Recorded when a fetch has been completed.
Each bucket of the histogram cointains the total size of all requests associated with frames with a particular frame status in kilobytes.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.CompletionDelay
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when a resource request completes to when the renderer is notified. Logged for every resource request.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.RedirectDelay
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when a redirect from a resource request happens to when the renderer is notified. Logged for every resource request redirect.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.ResponseDelay
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when a response from a resource request is started to when the renderer is notified. Logged for every resource request.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceRequest.StartDelay
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when the renderer starts a resource request to when it is actually started on the network. Logged for every resource request.

histogram.name: Blink.ScanPendingActivityDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to scan pending activities of all V8 wrappers in a worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Script.AsyncScriptCount
histogram.summary: The total number of async scripts associated with a document at the time parsing has finished.

histogram.name: Blink.Script.ForceDeferredScripts.Mainframe
histogram.obsolete: Obsoleted Feb 2021.
histogram.summary: Number of synchronous scripts that were deferred for a mainframe by the ForceDeferScriptIntervention. This includes both inline scripts and external scripts that had their execution deferred until after parsing completes. Recorded when there is at least one force deferred script for the frame.

histogram.name: Blink.Script.ForceDeferredScripts.Mainframe.External
histogram.obsolete: Obsoleted Feb 2021.
histogram.summary: Number of external synchronous scripts that were deferred for a mainframe by the ForceDeferScriptIntervention. Recorded when there is at least one force deferred script for the frame (not necessarily external).

histogram.name: Blink.Script.ForceDeferredScripts.Subframe
histogram.obsolete: Obsoleted Feb 2021.
histogram.summary: Number of synchronous scripts that were deferred for a subframe by the ForceDeferScriptIntervention. This includes both inline scripts and external scripts that had their execution deferred until after parsing completes. Recorded when there is at least one force deferred script for the frame.

histogram.name: Blink.Script.ForceDeferredScripts.Subframe.External
histogram.obsolete: Obsoleted Feb 2021.
histogram.summary: Number of external synchronous scripts that were deferred for a subframe by the ForceDeferScriptIntervention. Recorded when there is at least one force deferred script for the frame (not necessarily external).

histogram.name: Blink.Script.SchedulingType
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M90 because we collected enough insights.
histogram.summary: Number of script elements for each scheduling type, recorded for each successful #prepare-a-script.

histogram.name: Blink.ScrollDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document to ensure correct scroll behavior, such as scroll chaining or other programatic scrolling. Includes time spent in style update and layout.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.ScrollingCoordinator.UpdateTime
histogram.obsolete: Merged into Blink.CompositingCommit.UpdateTime in http://crrev.com/815947 in M88.
histogram.summary:
The time it took to update scrolling coordinator data (scroll gesture regions, touch event rects, and main thread scrolling reasons). These values are calculated during the main-thread blink lifecycle.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Blink.ServiceDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document to service browser driven behaviors. Examples include accessibility, intersection observer, display locking and spell checking. Includes time spent in style update and layout.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.BackendAvailability
histogram.summary: Records how often the verification backend is unavailable for the WebOTP API and the corresponding reason. This is recorded once per OTP request.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.PendingOriginCount
histogram.summary: SmsFetcher subscribes to incoming SMSes with origins from SmsProvider. This metric records the number of pending origins that are not unsubscribed when the SmsFetcher subscribes to new origins.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.DestroyedReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason an SMS Service is destroyed before request completion.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.Infobar
histogram.summary: Records how many times the infobar was called and how many times the infobar replaced a keyboard.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a call to the WebOTP API.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.SmsParsingStatus
histogram.summary:
Records the status of parsing an incoming SMS when using the WebOTP API. It records one sample per incoming SMS.
Note: This metric does not cover cross-devices WebOTP.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.TimeCancel
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when the API is called to when the request is cancelled by the service due to duplicated requests or lack of delegate.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.TimeCancelOnKeyboardDismissal
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when the keyboard was replaced with an infobar until when the user clicked the cancel button.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.TimeCancelOnSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the time from when a successful SMS was retrieved to when the user presses the Cancel button.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.TimeContinueOnSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the time from when a successful SMS was retrieved to when the user presses the Continue button.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.TimeSmsReceive
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when the API is called to when an SMS has been successfully received.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.TimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when the API is called to when the user successfully receives the SMS and presses continue to pass the incoming SMS to the site and proceed with the SMS verification flow.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.TimeUserCancel
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when the API is called to when the user successfully receives the SMS and presses "Deny" to terminate the SMS verification flow.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.WebContentsVisibleOnReceive
histogram.summary: Records whether the web contents that receives the OTP is visible or not for the UserConsent backend. Recorded at most once per API call when Chrome sees the OTP from the expected origin.

histogram.name: Blink.SpatialNavigation.Advance
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M85.
histogram.summary: Time it takes to find best candidate element, set focus or scroll for given directional input.

histogram.name: Blink.Style.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating style in the Blink document lifecycle.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.ThreadedIconLoader.LoadTime
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to finish successfully loading an icon using ThreadedIconLoader. Recorded whenever a blink module loads an icon using ThreadedIconLoader.

histogram.name: Blink.UpdateViewportIntersection.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing geometry information about iframes from the perspective of their embedding document. This time is also included in the Blink.IntersectionObservation.UpdateTime metric.
This histogram only records metrics on machines with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.AnimatedCSSProperties
histogram.summary: Records usage of animated CSS properties used on a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view via PageLoadMetricsObserver.
histogram.details:
This histogram counts CSS properties only when they are animated by a CSS Animation. Refer to Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties for more details.
As of M69, Blink.UseCounter.AnimatedCSSProperties is moved from the blink side to the browser side.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties
histogram.summary: Records usage of CSS properties used on a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view via PageLoadMetricsObserver.
histogram.details:
The first time a CSS property is parsed on a page, the histogram is updated to increment the counter. Each histogram bucket corresponds to a CSS property (eg. width, border-radius). The exception is the 'Total pages measured' bucket - this counts the number of pages that CSS properties were counted on. When a page navigation occurs the page count bucket is incremented and tracking of the set of which properties have been seen is reset.
These numbers give the percentage of pages that use a CSS property. For example, if the 'border-radius' histogram bucket has a count of 250, and the page count bucket (i.e. bucket number 1) has a count of 1000 - this means that 1000 pages were recorded, and border-radius was used on 25% of those pages.
Note that CSS properties used inside of SVG images are tracked separately in the Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.CSSProperties histogram.
As of M57 this histogram supercedes WebCore.FeatureObserver.CSSProperties.
As of M69, Blink.UseCounter.AnimatedCSSProperties is moved from the blink side to the browser side.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.DocumentPolicy.Enforced
histogram.summary: Counts enforced DocumentPolicyViolationReport generated in a document.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.DocumentPolicy.Header
histogram.summary: Counts the use of a specific document policy via the "Document-Policy" HTTP response header.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.DocumentPolicy.PolicyAttribute
histogram.summary: Counts the use of a specific document policy via the "policy" attribute. Each policy is counted only once per page load.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.DocumentPolicy.ReportOnly
histogram.summary: Counts report only DocumentPolicyViolationReport generated in a document.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.Extensions.Features
histogram.summary: Count of how many page loads use various features for pages with a chrome-extension:// URL only. The PageVisits bucket is incremented for each page load, and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via the WebCore::UserCounter class.
histogram.details: Warning: This histogram represents pre-renderer metrics and so is flawed under OOPIF.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.Allow
histogram.summary: Counts the use of a specific feature policy via the "allow" attribute. Each policy is counted only once per page load.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.AttributeAllowlistType
histogram.summary: Logs the type of allowlist used in a Feature-Policy "allow" attribute; whether it is empty, or contains only a single keyword, is composed only of keywords, or contains explicit tuple origins. Recorded at the point that the attribute is parsed.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.Header
histogram.summary: Counts the use of a specific feature policy via the "Feature-Policy" HTTP response header.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.HeaderAllowlistType
histogram.summary: Logs the type of allowlist used in a Feature-Policy header; whether it is empty, or contains only a single keyword, is composed only of keywords, or contains explicit tuple origins. Recorded at the point that the header is parsed.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.PotentialViolation
histogram.obsolete: Remoted in M91.
histogram.summary: Tracks potential violations of feature policies in a document. This is emitted once all the conditions for violating the feature policy are met in the document; regardless of whether or not the feature has been disabled in the document; in other words, it still records a potential violation even if there won't be a violation report generated. Note that this is recorded once per document.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.ProposalWouldChangeBehaviour
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M88.
histogram.summary: Counts when the result of calling IsFeatureEnabled for an Execution Context would be different under the proposal in https://crbug.com/937171. Each feature is counted only once per execution context.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.Features
histogram.summary: Count of how many page loads use various features across all frames in a page. The PageVisits bucket is incremented for each page load, and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via blink::UseCounter and UseCounterPageLoadMetricsObserver.
histogram.details: Note that features used inside of SVG images are tracked separately in the Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.Features histogram. Features used inside of extension pages are tracked separately in the Blink.UseCounter.Extensions.Features histogram.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.File.Features
histogram.summary: Count of how many `file:` URL page loads use various features across all frames in the page. This histogram has the same semantics as "Blink.UseCounter.Features", but applies only to `file:` URLs (which that histogram does not include).

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.MainFrame.Features
histogram.summary: Count of how many page loads use various features across in the main frame of a page. The PageVisits bucket is incremented at the beginning of each page load and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via blink::UseCounter and UseCounterPageLoadMetricsObserver throughout the lifetime of a page load metrics observer.
histogram.details: This histogram counts usage of web features in main frame only. Refer to Blink.UseCounter.Features for more details.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.PermissionsPolicy.Violation.Enforce
histogram.summary: Counts the actual enforced permissions policy violation. The metrics is triggered when ExecutionContext::IsFeatureEnabled with ReportOptions::ReportOnFailure as param returns false, at most once per page visit.

histogram.name: Blink.UserDrivenDocumentUpdate.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent preparing the document to service user driven behaviors. Examples include inspector, selection, editing, find-in-page and focus. Includes time spent in style update and layout.
This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.VisibleBeforeLoaded.LazyLoadEligibleFrames.BelowTheFold
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type whenever a lazyload-eligible (i.e. cross-origin and non-hidden) iframe that was initially below the fold becomes visible before it finishes loading.

histogram.name: Blink.VisibleBeforeLoaded.LazyLoadImages.AboveTheFold
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type whenever a lazily loaded image that was initially above the fold becomes visible before it finishes loading.

histogram.name: Blink.VisibleBeforeLoaded.LazyLoadImages.BelowTheFold
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type whenever a lazily loaded image that was initially below the fold becomes visible before it finishes loading.

histogram.name: Blink.VisibleLoadTime.LazyLoadEligibleFrames.AboveTheFold
histogram.summary: Milliseconds spent waiting for an above the fold iframe to load. Only fires for iframes that would be eligible for lazy loading, i.e. cross-origin and non-hidden.

histogram.name: Blink.VisibleLoadTime.LazyLoadEligibleFrames.BelowTheFold
histogram.summary: Milliseconds spent waiting for a below the fold iframe to load. Only fires for iframes that would be eligible for lazy loading, i.e. cross-origin and non-hidden.

histogram.name: Blink.VisibleLoadTime.LazyLoadImages.AboveTheFold
histogram.summary: Milliseconds spent waiting for an above the fold image element to load. 0ms is recorded if the image is already loaded by the time user scrolls to it. EffectiveConnectionType (2G, 3G, etc) is recorded as suffix to this histogram.

histogram.name: Blink.VisibleLoadTime.LazyLoadImages.BelowTheFold
histogram.summary: Milliseconds spent waiting for a below the fold image element to load. 0ms is recorded if the image is already loaded by the time user scrolls to it. EffectiveConnectionType (2G, 3G, etc) is recorded as suffix to this histogram.

histogram.name: Blink.WaitForCommit.UpdateTime
histogram.summary:
Time spent waiting for the compositor thread to begin processing a layer update inside ProxyMain::BeginMainFrame.
Note: This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.WebCodecs.ImageDecoder.Success
histogram.summary: Whether a given JavaScript ImageDecoder instance completed operation successfully or not. Logged upon destruction of the instance.

histogram.name: Blink.WebCodecs.ImageDecoder.Type
histogram.summary: Image codec provided to JavaScript ImageDecoder constructor. Logged once per successful construction upon completion of construction.

histogram.name: Blink.WebCodecs.{AudioCodecApi}.Codec
histogram.summary: The codec type used with {AudioCodecApi}. Recorded for every successful configure() call.

histogram.name: Blink.WebCodecs.{CodecApi}.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: The final media::StatusCode for each {CodecApi} instance. The final status code is either StatusCode::kOk or the first fatal error encountered. Recorded once upon destruction for each codec type.

histogram.name: Blink.WebCodecs.{VideoCodecApi}.Codec
histogram.summary: The codec type used with {VideoCodecApi}. Recorded for every successful configure() call.

histogram.name: Blink.WindowOpen.FromAdState
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the page called window.open() with an ad script in the stack and/or from an ad subframe. Recorded whenever window.open() is called when AdTagging is enabled.

histogram.name: Blink.{Host}.RenderTaskDuration.{Thread}.{Context}.{Resource}.{Filter}
histogram.summary:
Time spent executing a script task that draws content to a rendering context of a canvas element or OffscreenCanvas.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CollectionRate
histogram.summary: The percentage of objects that have been collected by a Blink GC. 0 is passed if there were no objects when a Blink GC started.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.GCReason
histogram.summary: A type of Blink GC.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.LowMemoryPageNavigationGC.Reduction
histogram.summary: Amount of memory reduced with the GC triggered on page navigation while the device is in a low memory state. Only implemented on low end Android devices at the moment. Memory usage is approximated by summing the memory usage of the following allocators: BlinkGC, PartitionAlloc, and V8 main thread isolate heap.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.MainThreadMarkingThroughput
histogram.summary: Marking throughput considering all durations of all marking phases on the main thread and marked bytes within one Blink garbage collection cycle. Reported once per garbage collection cycle at the end. Only reported for platforms supporting high resolution clocks and when more than 1MB of live objects have been found.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.ObjectSizeAfterGC
histogram.summary: The size of allocated objects just after Blink GC is triggered. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.ObjectSizeBeforeGC
histogram.summary: The size of allocated objects just before Blink GC is triggered. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.ObjectSizeFreedByHeapCompaction
histogram.summary: The total size of objects freed by BlinkGC's heap compaction. This is recorded once following each compaction.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForAtomicPhase
histogram.summary: Duration of overall garbage collection time when the garbage collector is invoked for finishing a garbage collection. This includes finishing up any already running garbage collection operation. Recorded at the end of each garbage collection.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForAtomicPhaseMarking
histogram.summary: Duration of finishing marking the transitive closure of objects during the final Blink garbage collection pause. Recorded at the end of each garbage collection.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForCompleteSweep
histogram.summary: Duration of the pause that completes sweeping. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForGCCycle
histogram.summary: Sum of all durations of individual phases within one Blink garbage collection. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForGlobalWeakProcessing
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run global weak processing of Blink GC. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForHeapCompaction
histogram.summary: Duration of wall time taken to run BlinkGC's heap compaction. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForIncrementalMarking
histogram.summary: Sum of all durations of incremental marking phases within one Blink garbage collection cycle. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForInvokingPreFinalizers
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run ThreadState::InvokePreFinalizers(). Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForMarking
histogram.summary: Accumulated sum of all durations of individual phases contributing to marking (main thread and background helpers) within one Blink garbage collection. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForMarkingRoots
histogram.summary: Duration of marking roots within one Blink garbage collection. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForNestedInV8
histogram.summary: Duration of the time of Blink garbage collection spent nested in a V8 garbage collection. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForSweepingBackground
histogram.summary: Sum of all durations of individual phases contributing to sweeping on background helpers within one Blink garbage collection. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForSweepingForeground
histogram.summary: Sum of all durations of individual phases contributing to sweeping on the main thread within one Blink garbage collection. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForSweepingSum
histogram.summary: Accumulated sum of all durations of individual phases contributing to sweeping (main thread and background helpers) within one Blink garbage collection. Reported once per garbage collection at the end.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForTotalCollectGarbage
histogram.summary: Duration of total Blink garbage collection time when the garbage collector is invoked for finishing a garbage collection. This includes finishing up any already running garbage collection operation as well as potentially performing a follow-up collection synchronously. Recorded each time after invoking the Blink garbage collector.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TotalAllocatedSpace
histogram.summary: The total size of allocated space in OS when a Blink GC is triggered.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TotalObjectSpace
histogram.summary: The total size of object space in all threads when a Blink GC is triggered.
